data.title: Boy survives being trapped underwater for 42 minutes. Doctors used a technique called extracorporeal membrane oxygenation to extract oxygen-deprived blood, warm it up and add oxygen, before pumping it back in.
Paris to remove close to a million ‘love locks’ left by romantic couples on Pont de Arts bridge
7.8 magnitude earthquake shakes buildings in Tokyo
Germany Shines Light on Rape by Troops Who Beat Nazis - New research by a German academic alleges that rape by U.S., British, French and Canadian forces was more commonplace than previously believed.
ISIS committed five million human right abuses in five months
Fifa corruption: Sepp Blatter blasts US authorities over investigation
French Constitutional Court rules unconstituional to cut water from people unable to pay, making it effectively unconstitutional to block water access to anyone
UNESCO heritage experts decide not to list Great Barrier Reef as 'in danger'

India's Air Pollution Is So Bad It's Causing Lung Damage in Kids: In lung tests conducted on 5,718 students, 43.5% suffered from “poor or restrictive lungs”. About half of the 4.4 million children who live in Delhi have irreversible lung damage.
Insanity Rules In Ireland: Media Ordered Not To Report On Parliamentary Speech
US demands immediate halt to South China Sea reclamations

Canada's Truth and Reconciliation Commission finds at least 6,000 aboriginal children died in the residential school system; 24 to 42 per cent of aboriginal children who attended the residential schools died at school or shortly after leaving school.
Beijing’s About to Roll Out Its Harshest Smoking Ban Ever: Smoking will be banned everywhere from the Great Wall to Beijing’s bars starting June 1
India ‘afraid’ Islamic State may get access to Pakistan’s nuclear arms
US sent live anthrax to Australia in military shipment
